datatyps.name: stStartGroupAddressUntracked

datatyps.name: stTempGroupAdress

name: FB_daliCommunication
comment:
* This Function Block handles the DALI Communication and Configuration for an KL6821 Card
 *
 * Need to be called in a fast Communication Task smaller than 6ms (best 2ms). The Related DALI Function Blocks need to be called between 10 and 60ms.
 * GVL_communication with aDali need to be present

datatyps.name: iUniqueCardNumber
datatyps.comment: Each Card on one PLC MUST have a unique Number 1...10

datatyps.name: eError
datatyps.comment: Dali Communication Card have an ERROR

datatyps.name: fbKL6821Config
datatyps.comment: Function Block to configure KL6821 DALI Communication Card

datatyps.name: fbKL6821Communication
datatyps.comment: Function Block for KL6821 DALI Communication Card

datatyps.name: fbRestartTimer
datatyps.comment: Restart Timer for DALI Communication Card

datatyps.name: stKL6821In
datatyps.comment: Input Struct from DALI Communication Card

datatyps.name: stKL6821Out
datatyps.comment: Output Struct to DALI Communication Card

datatyps.name: stCommIn
datatyps.comment: Input Struct from DALI Config Block to DALI Communication Block

datatyps.name: stCommOut
datatyps.comment: Output Struct from DALI Config Block to DALI Communication Block

datatyps.name: iOldUniqueCardNumber
datatyps.comment: Each Card on one PLC MUST have a unique Number 1...10 OLD VALUE

datatyps.name: bFirstCall
datatyps.comment: The first call of this Block after PLC start

datatyps.name: rDiffTemp
datatyps.comment: Diff Watertemp of Primary to Secondary

datatyps.name: rMinGap
datatyps.comment: Min Gap from rMaxSetpointTempRooms to Outside temperature

datatyps.name: eTemperatureSensorType
datatyps.comment: Sensor type of primary water sensor

datatyps.name: rDeadRange
datatyps.comment: Min change before new Value written to valve

name: FB_knxCommunication
comment:
* This Function Block handles the KNX Communication for an KL6301 Card with 4 Group Filters á 63 Elements

 * Need to be called in the same Task as the other KNX Function Blocks related to this KNX Communication path
 * GVL_communication with aKnx need to be present

datatyps.name: iUniqueCardNumber

datatyps.name: stPhysicalAddress

datatyps.name: stFilterGroupStartAddress1

datatyps.name: eLogLevelFalse
datatyps.comment: Loglevel when false need a different one then true

datatyps.name: sMessageTrue

datatyps.name: sMessageFalse

datatyps.name: sLogger

datatyps.name: aKl3208Out
datatyps.comment: Output Struct for one Channel of a KL3208 Card

datatyps.name: aKl3208In
datatyps.comment: Input Struct for one Channel of a KL3208 Card

datatyps.name: bBlocked
datatyps.comment: Circulation blocked e.g. Valve closed or something else

name: log4tc.FB_Log4TcTask
comment: Main code of Log4TC which manages log messages of a single task.

datatyps.name: pBuffer
datatyps.comment: pointer to the current message buffer

datatyps.name: nBufferCount
datatyps.comment: number of bytes written to the message buffer

datatyps.name: nBufferRemaining
datatyps.comment: remaining bytes in the message buffer

datatyps.name: bError
datatyps.comment: indicates an error in the current message building

datatyps.name: nAddLogToBuffer
datatyps.comment: Counts number of logs added to message buffer.

datatyps.name: nAddLogToBufferErrorCount
datatyps.comment: Counts error when adding log message to task buffer.

datatyps.name: nSendLogBufferErrorCount
datatyps.comment: Counts error when sending log task buffer to service.

datatyps.name: nMaxUsedBufferSize
datatyps.comment: Max. used buffer size of log task buffer.

name: POINTER TO POINTER TO POINTER TO DWORD

datatyps.name: bReady
datatyps.comment: DALI Communication Card is ready to send and receive

datatyps.name: stCommandBuffer
datatyps.comment: DALI Command Buffer for the DALI specific Function Blocks to communicate with the Hardware

datatyps.name: bReady
datatyps.comment: KNX Communication Card is ready to send and receive

datatyps.name: stDataStruct
datatyps.comment: KNX Data Structure for Send and Receive Blocks

name: Tc2_DALI.FB_KL6821Communication
comment: The blocks for the DALI commands do not access the process image of the KL6821 directly, but place the individual DALI commands in three different buffers.

datatyps.name: bResetMaximumDemandCounter
datatyps.comment: A rising edge at this input resets the value of the maximum command-buffer-load, arrBufferMaximumDemandMeter.

datatyps.name: bResetOverflowCounter
datatyps.comment: A rising edge at this input resets the value of the total buffer-overflow-counter, arrBufferOverflowCounter.

datatyps.name: bResetInactiveProcessImage
datatyps.comment: A positive edge cancels the blocking of the process image of the terminal.

datatyps.name: bBusy
datatyps.comment: When the block is activated the output is set, and it remains active until execution of the command has been completed.

datatyps.name: bError
datatyps.comment: This output is switched to TRUE if an error occurs during the execution of a command.

datatyps.name: nErrorId
datatyps.comment: Contains the command-specific error code of the most recently executed command.

datatyps.name: arrBufferMaximumDemandMeter
datatyps.comment: Previous maximum utilisation of the respective buffer (0  100%).

datatyps.name: bLineIsBusy
datatyps.comment: This output is set as long as the FB_KL6821Communication() block is active.

datatyps.name: bLineIsInitialized
datatyps.comment: If the block is being called for the first time (e.g. when the controller is starting up) an initialisation process is executed.

datatyps.name: bDigitalInput1Active
datatyps.comment: The digital input Input1 on the terminal has been or is actuated (see also the terminal documentation).

datatyps.name: bDigitalInput2Active
datatyps.comment: The digital input Input2 on the terminal has been or is actuated (see also the terminal documentation).

datatyps.name: bProcessImageInactive
datatyps.comment: One of the digital inputs Input1 or Input2 has been actuated on the terminal.

datatyps.name: bCollisionError
datatyps.comment: DALI collision detected during the transfer of a DALI telegram.

datatyps.name: bPowerSupplyError
datatyps.comment: The terminal has detected an error at the power supply.

datatyps.name: stInData
datatyps.comment: Structure in the input process image of the KL6821. It is used for communication from the KL6821 to the PLC.

datatyps.name: stOutData
datatyps.comment: Structure in the output process image of the KL6821. It is used for communication from the PLC to the KL6821.

datatyps.name: stCommandBuffer
datatyps.comment: A reference to the structure for communication with the FB_KL6811Communication() or FB_KL6821Communication() block.

name: Tc2_DALI.FB_KL6821Config
comment: This block is used to configure the KL6821.

datatyps.name: bConfigurate
datatyps.comment: Configuration of the Bus Terminal is started by a positive edge at this input.

datatyps.name: eCommandKBusWatchdog
datatyps.comment: Defines the DALI command that is sent as soon as the Bus Terminal is no longer addressed via the K-bus.

datatyps.name: eCommandDI1RisingEdge
datatyps.comment: Defines the DALI command that is sent as soon as a rising edge is detected at input 1 of the Bus Terminal.

datatyps.name: eCommandDI1FallingEdge
datatyps.comment: Defines the DALI command that is sent as soon as a falling edge is detected at input 1 of the Bus Terminal.

datatyps.name: eCommandDI2RisingEdge
datatyps.comment: Defines the DALI command that is sent as soon as a rising edge is detected at input 2 of the Bus Terminal.

datatyps.name: eCommandDI2FallingEdge
datatyps.comment: Defines the DALI command that is sent as soon as a falling edge is detected at input 2 of the Bus Terminal.

datatyps.name: ePowerSupplyMode
datatyps.comment: Defines the operation mode of the internal DALI power supply.

datatyps.name: bBusy
datatyps.comment: When the block is activated the output is set, and it remains active until execution of the command has been completed.

datatyps.name: bError
datatyps.comment: This output is switched to TRUE if an error occurs during the execution of a command.

datatyps.name: nErrorId
datatyps.comment: Contains the command-specific error code of the most recently executed command.

datatyps.name: nTerminalDescription
datatyps.comment: Contains the terminal designation (e.g. 6821). Corresponds to register 8 of the Bus Terminal.

datatyps.name: nFirmwareVersion
datatyps.comment: Contains the firmware version. Corresponds to register 9 of the Bus Terminal.

datatyps.name: sDescription
datatyps.comment: Terminal designation and firmware version as string (e.g. 'Terminal KL6821 / Firmware 2H').

datatyps.name: stInDataTerminal
datatyps.comment: Reference to the structure for communication with the KL6821.

datatyps.name: stOutDataTerminal
datatyps.comment: Reference to the structure for communication with the KL6821.

datatyps.name: stInData
datatyps.comment: Reference to the structure for communication with the function block FB_KL6821Communication().

datatyps.name: stOutData
datatyps.comment: Reference to the structure for communication with the function block FB_KL6821Communication().

datatyps.name: bLockMessageQueue
datatyps.comment: If this variable is true, access to the message queue is blocked for all FBs of the main task. This flag allows a FB exclusive access to the message queue until it resets the flag.

name: Tc2_DALI.ST_DALIV2EventTable
comment: only DALI Rev. 2

datatyps.name: bLockSemaphore
datatyps.comment: If this variable is true, the event table is locked by the main task. This flag will save the access to the write and read pointer from different tasks.

name: Tc2_DALI.ST_DALIV2EventTableItem
comment: only DALI Rev. 2

datatyps.name: nBufferReadPointer
datatyps.comment: Points to the last readed entry

datatyps.name: nBufferWritePointer
datatyps.comment: Points to the next free entry

datatyps.name: bLockSemaphore
datatyps.comment: If this variable is true, the message queue is locked by the main task. This flag will save the access to the write and read pointer from different tasks.

datatyps.name: bLockSemaphore
datatyps.comment: If this variable is true, the response table is locked by the main task. This flag will save the access to the write and read pointer from different tasks.

name: Tc2_DALI.ST_KL6811OutData
comment: Communication interface for the KL6811

name: Tc2_DALI.ST_KL6821InData
comment: Communication interface for the KL6821

name: Tc2_DALI.ST_KL6821OutData
comment: Communication interface for the KL6821

name: Tc2_EIB.EIB_2OCTET_FLOAT_REC
comment: This function block receives 2 bytes of unsign EIB data on the set group address and converts them into an IEC61131-3 UINT variable.

datatyps.name: Group_Address
datatyps.comment: Group address from which the data were sent. This group address must be entered in the filters!

datatyps.name: strData_Rec
datatyps.comment: The data structure with which the KL6301 function block (VAR_OUTPUT str_Data_Rec) must be linked.

datatyps.name: bDataReceive
datatyps.comment: This bit is set to FALSE for exactly one cycle when an EIB telegram with the group address is received.

datatyps.name: rData
datatyps.comment: Contains the user data of the received EIB telegram.

name: Tc2_EIB.EIB_8BIT_UNSIGN_REC
comment: This function block receives 8 bits of EIB data on the set group address and converts them into an IEC61131-3 BYTE variable.

datatyps.name: Group_Address
datatyps.comment: Group address from which the data were sent. This group address must be entered in the filters!

datatyps.name: strData_Rec
datatyps.comment: The data structure with which the KL6301 function block (VAR_OUTPUT str_Data_Rec) must be linked.

datatyps.name: bDataReceive
datatyps.comment: This bit is set to FALSE for exactly one cycle when an EIB telegram with the group address is received.

datatyps.name: byData
datatyps.comment: Contains the user data of the received EIB telegram.

name: Tc2_EIB.EIB_8BIT_UNSIGN_SEND_EX
comment: This function block sends an 8 Bit EIB value to the parameterized group address.

datatyps.name: bStart
datatyps.comment: Activates the block. The block starts to work in dependence of the parameterized mode (see iMode).

datatyps.name: Group_Address
datatyps.comment: Group address to which the data are sent.

datatyps.name: byData
datatyps.comment: Data that has to be sent. Value range 0x00...0xFF.

datatyps.name: str_Rec
datatyps.comment: The data structure with which the KL6301 function block (VAR_OUTPUT str_Data_Rec) must be linked.

datatyps.name: CyclePolling
datatyps.comment: Polling time for the polling mode. The minimum time is 200ms.

datatyps.name: MinSendTime
datatyps.comment: Interval time that has to be last at minimum until another telegram is changed in OnChange mode. The minimum time is 200ms.

datatyps.name: bEnableReadReq
datatyps.comment: Allows the execution of read commands.

datatyps.name: bBusy
datatyps.comment: The block is active. For new functions wait until bBusy is set back to FALSE.

datatyps.name: bError
datatyps.comment: The bError output becomes TRUE as soon as an error occurs.

datatyps.name: iErrorID
datatyps.comment: The iErrorID output issues an error code when an error occurs (EIB_ERROR_CODE).

name: Tc2_EIB.EIB_ALL_DATA_TYPES_REC
comment: This function block receives variable EIB data sizes on the set group address and outputs the raw data as a byte ARRAY.

datatyps.name: Group_Address
datatyps.comment: Group address from which the data were sent. This group address must be entered in the filters!

datatyps.name: strData_Rec
datatyps.comment: The data structure with which the KL6301 function block (VAR_OUTPUT str_Data_Rec) must be linked.

datatyps.name: bDataReceive
datatyps.comment: This bit is set to FALSE for exactly one cycle when an EIB telegram with the group address is received.

datatyps.name: EIB_Data_Receive
datatyps.comment: Contains the user data of the received EIB telegram.

datatyps.name: EIB_Data_Len
datatyps.comment: Contains the user data length of the incoming EIB telegram.

datatyps.name: bEIB_READ
datatyps.comment: TRUE = EIB READ COMMAND. FALSE = Normal EIB telegram.

name: Tc2_EIB.EIB_BIT_REC
comment: This function block receives 1 bit of EIB data on the set group address and converts them into an IEC61131-3 BOOL variable.

datatyps.name: Group_Address
datatyps.comment: Group address from which the data were sent. This group address must be entered in the filters!

datatyps.name: strData_Rec
datatyps.comment: The data structure with which the KL6301 function block (VAR_OUTPUT str_Data_Rec) must be linked.

datatyps.name: bDataReceive
datatyps.comment: This bit is set to FALSE for exactly one cycle when an EIB telegram with the group address is received.

name: Tc2_EIB.EIB_BIT_SEND_EX
comment: This function block sends an 1 Bit EIB value to the parameterized group address.

datatyps.name: bStart
datatyps.comment: Activates the block. The block starts to work in dependence of the parameterized mode (see iMode).

datatyps.name: CyclePolling
datatyps.comment: Polling time for the polling mode. The minimum time is 200ms.

datatyps.name: MinSendTime
datatyps.comment: Interval time that has to be last at minimum until another telegram is changed in OnChange mode. The minimum time is 200ms.

datatyps.name: Group_Address
datatyps.comment: Group address to which the data are sent.

datatyps.name: bData
datatyps.comment: The data value in REAL. This is automatically converted to an EIB 2OCTET FLOAT value.

datatyps.name: str_Rec
datatyps.comment: The data structure with which the KL6301 function block (VAR_OUTPUT str_Data_Rec) must be linked.

datatyps.name: bEnableReadReq
datatyps.comment: Allows the execution of read commands.

datatyps.name: bBusy
datatyps.comment: The block is active. For new functions wait until bBusy is set back to FALSE.

datatyps.name: bError
datatyps.comment: The bError output becomes TRUE as soon as an error occurs.

datatyps.name: iErrorID
datatyps.comment: The iErrorID output issues an error code when an error occurs (EIB_ERROR_CODE).

name: Tc2_EIB.EIB_READ_SEND
comment: This function block sends a Read_Group_Req to the set group address.

datatyps.name: Group_Address
datatyps.comment: Group address to which the data are sent.

datatyps.name: bRead
datatyps.comment: Rising edge starts the block and sends a Read_Group_Req to the EIB device.

datatyps.name: str_Rec
datatyps.comment: The data structure with which the KL6301 function block (VAR_OUTPUT str_Data_Rec) must be linked.

datatyps.name: bError
datatyps.comment: The bError output becomes TRUE as soon as an error occurs.

datatyps.name: iErrorID
datatyps.comment: The iErrorID output issues an error code when an error occurs (EIB_ERROR_CODE).

datatyps.name: bBusy
datatyps.comment: The block is active. For new functions wait until bBusy is set back to FALSE.

name: Tc2_EIB.KL6301
comment: This function block deals with the KL6301 EIB Bus Terminal communication.

datatyps.name: bActivate
datatyps.comment: Activates the block that configures the KL6301 and then activates the data exchange.

datatyps.name: idx
datatyps.comment: If more than one Bus Terminal per PLC program is used, each KL6301 must have a unique idx number. Valid values 1...64.

datatyps.name: EIB_PHYS_ADDR
datatyps.comment: Physical EIB address. The default address is 1.2.3. This address must be unique in the EIB network!

datatyps.name: EIB_GROUP_FILTER
datatyps.comment: Group address filter. A maximum of 8 filters are possible.

datatyps.name: iMode
datatyps.comment: 0: FW B0 and higher - group filter 4/64; 1: FW B1 and higher - group filter 8/32; 2: FW B3 and higher - inverted group filter 8/32; 100: FW B1 and higher - monitor function

datatyps.name: tTimeout
datatyps.comment: Time that a send function block has to transmit an EIB frame until a timeout is signaled.

datatyps.name: bReady
datatyps.comment: The block is ready for sending and receiving data.

datatyps.name: bError
datatyps.comment: The bError output becomes TRUE as soon as an error occurs.

datatyps.name: iErrorId
datatyps.comment: The iErrorId output issues an error code when an error occurs (EIB_ERROR_CODE).

datatyps.name: str_Data_Rec
datatyps.comment: Connected with the send and receive blocks (VAR_INPUT str_Rec).

datatyps.name: KL6301_IN
datatyps.comment: Linked with the KL6301 input addresses.

datatyps.name: KL6301_OUT
datatyps.comment: Linked with the KL6301 output addresses.

datatyps.name: bDone
datatyps.comment:
udiStatus := 0; 	No status
		udiStatus := 1; 	Persistent data read successfully
		udiStatus := 2;	Backup from persistent data read
		udiStatus := 3; 	Neither persistent nor backup data read

datatyps.name: bStartWarnLevel
datatyps.comment: rising edge starts the warning delay

datatyps.name: bStartAlarmLevel
datatyps.comment: rising edge starts the alarming delay

datatyps.name: bSysTakt1Hz
datatyps.comment: 1hz signal instead system time or if the system time is not correct

datatyps.name: bConfigurate
datatyps.comment: Rising edge starts configuration including read-configuration afterwards

datatyps.name: bReadConfig
datatyps.comment: Rising edge reads the actual configuration

datatyps.name: iSetSensorType
datatyps.comment: Sensor-type to be set, see table

datatyps.name: tTimeout
datatyps.comment: Time-out-time for Reading/Configuration - initially set to 5s

datatyps.name: bBusy
datatyps.comment: Reading or configuration is in progress

datatyps.name: iErrorId
datatyps.comment: Id of the last upcoming error

datatyps.name: iState
datatyps.comment: As long as the funcion-block is not busy, this variable shows the state of the terminal, otherwise it is 0

datatyps.name: iDataIn
datatyps.comment: As long as the funcion-block is not busy, this variable shows the dataIn of the terminal, otherwise it keeps the value previous to reding/configuration

datatyps.name: sDescription
datatyps.comment: Terminal-type, special-type and firmware-version as readable text

name: Tc2_Standard.F_TRIG
comment: Falling Edge detection.

name: Tc2_Standard.R_TRIG
comment: Rising Edge detection.

datatyps.name: IN
datatyps.comment: starts timer with falling edge, resets timer with rising edge

datatyps.name: PT
datatyps.comment: time to pass, before Q is set

datatyps.name: Q
datatyps.comment: is FALSE, PT seconds after IN had a falling edge

datatyps.name: IN
datatyps.comment: starts timer with rising edge, resets timer with falling edge

datatyps.name: PT
datatyps.comment: time to pass, before Q is set

datatyps.name: Q
datatyps.comment: gets TRUE, delay time (PT) after a rising edge at IN

name: Tc2_Standard.TP
comment:
Pulse Timer.
	Q produces a High-Signal with the length of PT on every rising edge on IN.

datatyps.name: IN
datatyps.comment: Trigger for Start of the Signal

datatyps.name: PT
datatyps.comment: The length of the High-Signal in 10ms

datatyps.name: ET
datatyps.comment: The current phase of the High-Signal

name: Tc2_System.ADSREAD
comment: ADS read command.

datatyps.name: LEN
datatyps.comment: Max. number of data bytes to read (LEN <= max. size of destination buffer)

datatyps.name: TMOUT
datatyps.comment: Maximum time allowed for the execution of this ADS command

name: Tc2_System.ADSWRITE
comment: ADS write command.

datatyps.name: LEN
datatyps.comment: Max. number of data bytes to write (LEN <= max. size of source buffer)

datatyps.name: TMOUT
datatyps.comment: Maximum time allowed for the execution of this ADS command

name: Tc2_System.DRAND
comment: Random number generator.

name: Tc2_System.GETCPUCOUNTER
comment:
The CPU cycle counter can be read with this function block. 
	The numerical value is a relative 64 bit integer, which, independently of the CPUs internal clock rate, is output in a form converted into 100ns ticks. 
	The number is refreshed to a precision of 100ns with every call by the PLC system, and can be used, for instance, for timing tasks. 
	One unit is equivalent to 100 ns.

datatyps.name: cpuCntLoDW
datatyps.comment: Contains the low-value 4 bytes of the numerical value

datatyps.name: cpuCntHiDW
datatyps.comment: Contains the high-value 4 bytes of the numerical value

name: Tc2_System.GETCURTASKINDEX
comment: This function block GETCURTASKINDEX finds the task index of the task from which it is called.

datatyps.name: index
datatyps.comment: Returns the current task index of the calling task.

name: Tc2_System.GETSYSTEMTIME
comment:
With this block the operating system time stamp can be read. 
	The time stamp is a 64 bit integer value, with a precision of 100ns, which is updated with every call of the PLC. 
	Amongst other uses, it can be utilised for timing tasks or time measurements. 
	One unit is equivalent to 100 ns.

datatyps.name: timeLoDW
datatyps.comment: Contains the low-value 4 bytes of the time stamp

datatyps.name: timeHiDW
datatyps.comment: Contains the high-value 4 bytes of the time stamp

name: Tc2_Utilities.FB_WritePersistentData
comment: This function block initiatializes storage of the persistent data from the PLC program

datatyps.name: PORT
datatyps.comment: Contains the ADS port number of the PLC run-time system whose persistent data is to be stored (851, 852...)

datatyps.name: START
datatyps.comment: Rising edge on this input activates the fb execution

name: Tc2_Utilities.NT_GetTime
comment: Reads local windows system time (struct)

datatyps.name: START
datatyps.comment: Rising edge on this input activates the fb execution

name: Tc2_Utilities.RTC_EX2
comment: Software RTC (real time clock), returns time in structured system time format + microseconds (microsecond resolution)

datatyps.name: PDT
datatyps.comment: Preset/set time in system time format (struct)

datatyps.name: Q
datatyps.comment: TRUE => Output time is valid, FALSE => Output time is invalid

datatyps.name: CDT
datatyps.comment: Current time in system time format (struct)

name: Tc2_Utilities.ST_AmsRouteEntry
comment: TwinCAT AMS route entry struct

datatyps.name: sAddress
datatyps.comment: String containing route network Ipv4 address or host name.

datatyps.name: bias
datatyps.comment:
Specifies the current bias, in minutes, for local time translation on this computer.
						The bias is the difference, in minutes, between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.
						UTC = local time + bias

datatyps.name: standardName
datatyps.comment:
Specifies a null-terminated string associated with standard time
								on this operating system.

datatyps.name: standardDate
datatyps.comment:
Specifies a SYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the
								transition from daylight saving time to standard time occurs on this operating system.

datatyps.name: standardBias
datatyps.comment: Specifies a bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during standard time.

datatyps.name: daylightName
datatyps.comment:
Specifies a null-terminated string associated with daylight saving time on this operating system.
								For example, this member could contain "PDT" to indicate Pacific Daylight Time.

datatyps.name: daylightDate
datatyps.comment:
Specifies a SYSTEMTIME structure that contains a date and local time when the transition
								from standard time to daylight saving time occurs on this operating system.

datatyps.name: daylightBias
datatyps.comment: Specifies a bias value to be used during local time translations that occur during daylight saving time.

name: Tc2_Utilities.T_Arg
comment: Argument type

datatyps.name: cbLen
datatyps.comment: Argument data byte length (if eType = ARGTYPE_STRING => cbLen = length of string + 1 (null delimiter).

datatyps.name: pData
datatyps.comment: Pointer to first argument data byte

name: Tc2_Utilities.T_FILETIME
comment: The FILETIME structure is a 64-bit value representing the number of 100-nanosecond intervals since January 1, 1601 (UTC).

datatyps.name: dwLowDateTime
datatyps.comment: Specifies the low-order 32 bits of the file time.

datatyps.name: dwHighDateTime
datatyps.comment: Specifies the high-order 32 bits of the file time.

name: Tc2_Utilities.T_ULARGE_INTEGER
comment: 64 bit unsigned integer

name: Tc2_Utilities.TIMESTRUCT
comment: System Time Structure

datatyps.name: wDayOfWeek
datatyps.comment: Day of the week: 0..6 (Sunday = 0, Monday = 1, .. , Saturday = 6 and so on)
